intro: Malope malacoides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Malope malacoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
